CatDescriptText: Mr. Ralph Buonocore, bartender, 2909 Chartiers Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The Congressmen from the South. You can't change the spots of a leopard.  If whites and Negroes were brought up together, like in North, it would be much different."
TitMainTitle: Ralph Buonocore wearing dark necktie with clip and eyeglasses, holding dark hat, left hand on hip, facing man wearing dark suit, patterned necktie, and eyeglasses, writing in notebook, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers store window, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
